H0.text: Which crusade was led by Philip II Augustus of France and Richard I of England. 2nd Crusade

H1.text: Which crusade was led by Philip II Augustus of France and Richard I of England. 4th Crusade

H2.text: Which crusade was led by Philip II Augustus of France and Richard I of England. 5th Crusade

H3.text: Which crusade was led by Philip II Augustus of France and Richard I of England. 3rd Crusade

A4.text: The Third Crusade (1189â€“1192) was an attempt led by King Philip II of France, King Richard I of England, and Emperor Frederick Barbarossa to reconquer the Holy Land following the capture of Jerusalem by the Ayyubid sultan Saladin in 1187.

A5.text: It was partially successful, recapturing the important cities of Acre and Jaffa, and reversing most of Saladin's conquests, but it failed to recapture Jerusalem, which was the major aim of the Crusade and its religious focus.
